text: As Hermes once took to his feathers light, When lulled Argus, baffled, swooned and slept,
When lulled Argus, baffled, swooned and slept, So on a Delphic reed, my idle spright
So on a Delphic reed, my idle spright%% So played, so charmed, so conquered, so bereft
So played, so charmed, so conquered, so bereft%% The dragon-world of all its hundred eyes;
The dragon-world of all its hundred eyes; And seeing it asleep, so fled away--
And seeing it asleep, so fled away-- Not to pure Ida with its snow-cold skies,
Not to pure Ida with its snow-cold skies, Nor unto Tempe, where Jove grieved a day;
Nor unto Tempe, where Jove grieved a day; But to that second circle of sad Hell,
But to that second circle of sad Hell, Where in the gust, the whirlwind, and the flaw
Where in the gust, the whirlwind, and the flaw%% Of rain and hail-stones, lovers need not tell
Of rain and hail-stones, lovers need not tell%% Their sorrows. Pale were the sweet lips I saw,
Their sorrows. Pale were the sweet lips I saw, Pale were the lips I kissed, and fair the form
Pale were the lips I kissed, and fair the form%% I floated with, about that melancholy storm.
